greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Unluckiness of n.
comment: If n is lucky, a(n)=0; if n is unlucky, a(n) is the step at which n is rejected from the lucky number sieve.
link: Max Barrentine, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = (1-A145649(n)) * A260438(n). - _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 11 2016, corrected Nov 15 2019
results.author: _Max Barrentine_, Dec 17 2015
